metadata.title: CVE-2018-9415 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In driver_override_store and driver_override_show of bus.c, there is apossible double free due to improper locking. This could lead to localescalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions:Android kernel Android ID: A-69129004 References: Upstream kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-128-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-lowlatency - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-128.154

linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-128-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-128.154').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
